qas.question: Who had Kerry considered running against in 1970?
In which district had Kerry considered running in 1970?
Who ran against Philbin instead of Kerry?

answers.text: to become Under-Secretary-General for Political and General Assembly Affairs at the United Nations

qas.question: What political party was Morse in?

context: In 1970, Kerry had considered running for Congress in the Democratic primary against hawkish <a0_0>Democrat Philip J. Philbin<a0_0/> of <a1_0>Massachusetts's 3rd congressional district<a1_0/>, but deferred in favour of <a2_0>Robert Drinan<a2_0/>, a Jesuit priest and anti-war activist, who went on to defeat Philbin. In February 1972, Kerry's wife bought a house in Worcester, with Kerry intending to run against the 4th district's ageing thirteen-term incumbent Democrat, Harold Donohue. The couple never moved in. After <a4_0>Republican<a4_0/> Congressman F. Bradford Morse of the neighbouring 5th district announced his retirement and then resignation <a3_0>to become Under-Secretary-General for Political and General Assembly Affairs at the United Nations<a3_0/>. The couple instead rented an apartment in Lowell, so that Kerry could run to succeed him.
